intro: Microcharis disjuncta var. fallax, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas in tropical and subtropical regions.
